Type.Name: ExecutionEngineException

TypeSignature.Value: .class public sealed serializable ExecutionEngineException extends System.SystemException

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Represents an internal error in the execution engine.

block.para: Execution engine errors are fatal errors that should never occur. Such errors occur mainly when the execution engine has been corrupted or data is missing.
The system can throw this exception at any time. When possible, the system throws an exception that provides more information than the exception.
For information on conditions under which the CLI throws exceptions, see Partition II of the CLI Specification.

summary.para: Constructs and initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.para: This constructor initializes the property of the new instance to a system-supplied message that describes the error, such as "Internal error occurred." This message takes into account the current system culture.

MemberSignature.Value: public rtspecialname specialname instance void .ctor(string message)

Docs.param: A that describes the error. The content of is intended to be understood by humans. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
